intro: Marrubium condensatum, commonly known as the condensed horehound, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and is known for its medicinal properties, including potential anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic effects. Marrubium condensatum is also valued in traditional herbal medicine for its aromatic and therapeutic uses.
